title.rendered: Incopro joins the INDICAM to share anti-counterfeiting expertise

content.rendered:
7 June 2019 – Incopro, the online brand protection provider, today announced that it had joined the Italian anti-counterfeiting Association, INDICAM (Istituto di Centromarca per lotta alla contraffazione), as a member.

As a member, Incopro will share its experience developing anti-counterfeiting strategies and discuss how an intelligence-led approach to online brand protection is useful for identifying and removing the largest infringers.   

INDICAM has over 150 international members from across industry, combining years of expertise in defending intellectual property. Their members lobby for the development and distribution of brand protection technology designed to prevent counterfeiting activity. They also share insights with law makers and institutions to enhance the existing legal framework. 

Incopro’s online brand protection tool, Talisman, and legal expertise is harnessed by a growing global customer base who are able to focus on the biggest threats to their intellectual property, protecting their reputation and online revenues. 
Giuditta Boscheri, Business Development Director at Incopro commented: “Incopro is pleased to announce that is now a member of INDICAM, the leading Italian association for the protection of intellectual property rights. We share the association’s dedication to fighting against widespread online counterfeiting and look forward to cooperating to make the internet a safer place for business”.

About Incopro

Incopro is an online IP and brand protection provider that arms brand owners with actionable intelligence to combat online and offline intellectual property and copyright infringements. Its flagship product, Talisman, combines big data and machine learning technology with legal and law enforcement expertise to gather and analyse relevant data for its customers. 

Comprised of experts in IP law, investigation, engineering and technical design who are fluent in over 45 languages, Incopro delivers measurable reductions in online vulnerability that deliver direct financial benefits to clients. Founded in 2012 by CEO and IP protection lawyer Simon Baggs, & CTO and system architect Bret Boivin, Incopro protects brands facing the threat of IP infringement. 

Incopro has operations in the UK, France, Germany, Italy, USA & China and employs over 175 people. Over 600 brands are protected with its software, including Dr. Martens, Harley Davidson, Cath Kidston, Superdry, New Era, Brother, ghd and Ted Baker. 

About the INDICAM

The INDICAM is a cross-industry initiative between brands, associations, brand protection providers, professional consulting and law firms, and private investigative services. Its growing network campaigns for modern legal infrastructure that guarantees IP rights are protected online and offline. The association’s vast collective experience is shared to develop effective anti-counterfeiting strategies.
